alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fauquier; Orange; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 30 at 4:01PM EDT until August 30 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN STAFFORD...NORTHEASTERN ORANGE...SOUTHEASTERN FAUQUIER AND SOUTHEASTERN CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 401 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bealeton, or 12 miles southeast of Warrenton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bealeton, Nokesville, Opal, Catlett, Calverton, Midland, Roseville, Auburn, Lois, Casanova, Heflin, Storck, Richardsville, Morrisville, Ruby, Somerville, Goldvein, Sumerduck and Bristersburg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
